document_data.mainbody:
'''Deadsnows''' was a large village located on the northern edge of the [[Nether Mountains]] in the [[Old Delzoun]] region of [[Luruar]]. It experienced a great boon, with throngs of visitors and travelers thanks to a gold rush,

Before its destruction, Deadsnows was the smallest member of the confederacy of the [[Silver Marches]] and would not have normally been accepted as a signatory unless as a vassal to a larger city. Due to the request of Lady [[Arletha Icespear]] it was allowed to join and garner the league's protection, though without a seat on the council.

Description.Inhabitants:
Although the town often seemed to be bursting at the seems with travelers looking to find fortune, it was fairly well-regulated by Lady Icespear. The chaos, which often included disorderly conduct or public drunkenness, was kept to a minimum by the local militia, led by the ''Captain of the Watch'', [[Mannock]].

document_data.Geography:
Deadsnows was nestled in the eponymous Deadsnows Vale, on the northern side of the Raurin mountains in [[Old Delzoun]]. The village was connected via [[Deadsnows Track|a trail]] to the [[Fork Road]], just south of the [[Ironhand Mines]]. 

Just west of the town was the [[Icespear Stream]] and beyond them, to the northwest, were the ''upland pastures'' an area of the valleys walls used to herd livestock. This pastoral display was shadowed by rocky crags of the Nether Mountains south of the town.

Landmarks.Hospice of Marthammor: : A sanctuary for travelers just run by [[dwarves]] who venerated [[Marthammor Duin]].
Landmarks.Icespear House: : Home to the [[Icespear]] family for generations, this stone and wood mansion served as the hub through which Lady Icespear conducted her diplomatic business with outsiders. It was protected by the [[Lady's Guard]], a group of hired soldiers led by Catain [[Rivha Stormevik]].
Landmarks.Snowtown: :This seasonal collective of merchants, miners, prospectors and travelers would spring up outside the northwestern walls of Deadsnows during the warmer months of the year.
Landmarks.Upland pastures: : The elevated grasslands of the valley were used by the town's herders and shepherds to raise livestock such as sheep and [[goat]]s.

Inns and taverns.[[Blazon]]: :An overpriced tavern owned by the shrewd businessman [[Lonnor]]. It was mostly patroned by town locals who sought refuge from the crowds brought in by the gold rush.
Inns and taverns.[[Vandarhouse]]: : Located in northern part of ''Snowtown'', this simple barn was run by an inn by its[[half-orc]] proprietress, [[Vandar]]. It's "tavern" consisted of a tent from which the cheapest ale was dispensed.
Inns and taverns.[[Rose and Hammer]]: : The only actual inn within the walls of the village. It had twelve private rooms and a common dormitory that could house twenty. It was run by a woman named [[Rose Torlund|Rose]] and her husband [[Hedrick Torlund|Hedrick "Hammer" Torlund]].

Shops.Haskar's shop: : An outfitter's shop, run by [[Haskar Riverside]], that catered to hunters, lumberers and of course the throngs of prospectors and miners that came to Deadsnows ''en masse'' to find their fortune.
Shops.Morwenna's shop: : This local apothecary was was passed down to the herbalist [[Morwenna Dresdtinn]] by her father some time before the [[Time of Troubles]]. Morwenna was skilled at her craft and provided a variety of herbal cures, as well as [[potion]]s, for her patrons.

Temples.[[The Morning Watchtower]]: : A converted watchtower that became a temple of Lathander, led by [[Morninglord]], [[Ashar|Ashar the Humble]].
